Articles.Content: Thank you KSP! For a year and a half ive played this and it's still my favorite game! Hats off to you!

If kerbal space program was an organic thing, i'd have babies with it.

It may not be an organic thing, but we still get mooned Mun-ed.

This truly is an amazing game! Thanks, Squad!

-awesome picture-

What mod is that from? It looks really awesome.
It's from the FASA Mercury and Gemini Pack. Here's the Spaceport link for it: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/gemini-and-mercury-frizzank-aeronautical-space-administration-fasa/

Squad, I just have to say thank you for this amazing, fantastic game.

I bought KSP over a year ago with some of my friends. I can easily say the first week of learning to build a functional rocket was so intensely frustrating to me, but I just couldn't stop. Every day I spent hours with this game; figuring out the physics, optimizing my rockets, learning how to alter my orbits, etc. But the satisfaction of finally being able to step back and say "I know what I'm doing now" is one of the best feelings a game has ever given me.

This game is by far my favorite game. There have been times where I've taken long breaks from it during school when I didn't have enough time, but I have never gotten bored. I always come back. It's addictive and fun and beautifully complex.

Thank you for this brilliant idea of yours. KSP has challenged me time and time again, and the joy I get out of pulling off a mission is unparalleled.

Hello,

My thanks as well and the above poster couldnt have said it better !

I have learned about Blender now and want to learn how to build simple mods; learning the game in the Kerbin Academy SIM then off to the real missions for some ROLEPLAY that just is lookin awesome in itself if it works out !

I havnt touched any other games for almost a month now probly...I do realize you are qorking on a different game of similar sorts and I am sure it will be as great as this one !

Cdr Zeta

I can safely say that KSP is one of my top 5 games of all time (coming from someone who lives for video games)

After seeing all of the games that have been coming out lately, where it seems like all the developers care about is squeezing out the next iteration so they can get more money from people who will buy the same game every year, it's so refreshing to see a group of people that actually want to make a great game.

KSP has it all. It's very entertaining, funny, crazy, motivating, exciting, rewarding and even educational.

It's also great to see that the developers are so connected with their fans, and how much support (and what would seem like encouragement) there is for the modding community.

It is an overly addictive game that I can see myself playing for a very, very, very long time.

And with that being said, all I want to say now is thank you to the developers. You are doing such an amazing job and deserve to be proud of the work you've done.
Squad thank you so much for this game. I got the demo and had to wait for about three months to find money to buy it. I cant wait to see how far this games goes.

This has been one of the most amazing and addicting games I've ever played (which is saying something, given that I usually prefer role-playing games and shooters). I like to play at being creative and mess around with exploding things, and I couldn't think of a game more suited to that than KSP. My only complaint is that I got introduced to it a few weeks before exams... meh, who needs college. TO SPACE!

that thing whatever it`s called(no not kerbol).that tiny little detail makes the game look so beautiful,even though the repeating textures and the 2D trees.the game the best looking I know.Thank you squad.
Squad, thanks for being awesome, thanks for being so open to the community. You've fueled my desire to get into game development even more.
Don't listen to the naysayers, you have made the best game ever, an it's not even done yet. I expect great things!

Don't listen to the naysayers, you have made the best game ever, an it's not even done yet. I expect great things!

Hear, hear! My sentiments exactly. I'm looking forward to many more hours of lost sleep, shirked responsibilities, and exasperated eye-rolling from my wife, all in the name of KSP!

Ferb, I Know What We're Gonna Do Today!

I'm sure I'll enjoy planting flags immensely. Thanks team!
Thanks for making the "squad intro" just an initial loader image (so when I load a 0 part, 0 interrior game for plugin testing, it loads instantly)

Thank you for all the hours lost to this game It just keeps getting better and better.

Naysayers remember: Beta is beta! We're testing this game.

I'd like to add my thanks to the Squad team for putting this game out too. I have only been playing since 19.1 but I've put in nearly 300hrs in the game experimenting, exploring, enjoying mods like Kethane, MechJeb, Mapsat more parts that i could use, etc. I overdid at first and with .2 I'm back to mods I actually use. And I'm enjoying starting over. It helps that I've been a space follower since I was a kid but also a gamer since Atari. As far as time spent and enjoyment, this game is a milestone game for me like Civilization, Ultima 7, and Fallout 3 to name a few. Thanks all, and I look forward to more in the coming months.

Would just like to say you guys did a great job with 0.20! I have 23 mods installed, debug toolbar database show 644 parts! And it's not slow to use the program!

Great job! Keep the good work coming!

I would like to say thank you for an amazing game. I also want to thank you for the countless hours the team has put into this game, making it better and better every time a new update is released. Since .14, every new update has been like Christmas morning.

This game has inspired me, entertained me, and I want to give my personal thanks for all of your hard work over the past years. I look forward to watching this game mature into the best game that I have ever played. In short, Thanks SQUAD.

Guys, long time player here, want to say thanks for 0.20. I was an exile from KSP for 0.19 since my system just couldn't handle it. I know memory optimization is frustrating to do, but you gave me the game back. Thank you!

Squad, KSP was an amazing idea, that translated into an amazing game with an awesome community.

And it has educational parralels!

KERBAL SPACE PROGRAM, the most amazing game since there are PC's. I am serious.

It is so addictive, because it is two things mixed together: Space and pure Creativity. This mixture makes the most awesome game ever. I even bought Jebediah Kerman on IVA from Shapeways. It is worth it!

Please don't stop developing it, even when there is KSP 1.0, just dont stop, because everyone will still wait for 1.1. Or 2.0. Or...

Thank you, all Developers of Squad. You are great.
i have been playing KSP so much that i never got around to posting this... THANK YOU. thank you, for chewing up so many of my weekends.
ty, i had to buy the game, works and is a lot of fun, hoping someday for a editor so we can expand the universe and add tons of more solar system
Kerbal Space Program is one of the best space sandboxes I've ever played. Amazing idea and great gameplay - Thank You Squad for hours of entertainment!
